byline.contributor: Wai Moe reported from Naypyidaw, and Austin Ramzy from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By WAI MOE and AUSTIN RAMZY

abstract: U Htin Kyaw is elected president of Myanmar, becoming first civilian to hold position since 1962.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Myanmar: First Civilian President Since 1962 Is Elected
headline.main: Myanmar Lawmakers Name Htin Kyaw President, Affirming Civilian Rule

snippet: U Htin Kyaw, a confidant of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, was considered almost certain to take the presidency after his nomination last week by her party.
lead_paragraph: U Htin Kyaw, a confidant of Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, was considered almost certain to take the presidency after his nomination last week by her party.
